#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Ride a Destination Dispatch Elevator
#Text=A destination dispatch elevator is an elevator that uses a different algorithm than most elevators .
#Text=Unlike most elevators , there are no floor buttons inside the lift , or , if there are floor buttons , they are usually disabled .
#Text=Knowing how to use a destination dispatch elevator is important if you encounter one .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Before You Enter the Car
#Text=Approach the keypad or touchscreen knowing your destination floor .
#Text=Enter your destination floor on the keypad or touchscreen .
#Text=To return to the ground floor , press the key , and to go to any basement floors , press the or key followed by the basement number .
#Text=If you have a disability , press the handicap button and follow the prompts read aloud to you .
#Text=This will also hold the elevator doors open for longer when the elevator arrives .
#Text=Proceed to the car listed on the display .
#Text=Follow the arrow .
#Text=The elevator will group you to a car going to the specified destination floor .
#Text=The appropriate elevator hall lantern will also light up and will blink upon arrival .
#Text=Wait for the doors to open .
#Text=Then confirm the lift is going to your destination floor by checking the floor numbers on the inside or outside of the car match the number of your destination floor .
#Text=Once you have confirmed that , step onto the elevator , be mindful of the gap , and hold the doors for all the other passengers .
#Text=Inside the Elevator
#Text=Allow all passengers going to your floor to board the car .
#Text=Destination dispatch elevators group passengers by putting passengers going to similar floors in the same car , reducing the number of stops .
#Text=Press the " Door close " button like normal once everyone entered the car .

column1: #Text=This may not work if you pressed the handicapped " ♿ " button .
#Text=Watch the floor indicator and/or the numbers on the door jamb .
#Text=Your number will blink when you are about to arrive at your floor .
#Text=Be courteous of other passengers .
#Text=Practice normal elevator etiquette under Ride an Elevator .
#Text=Destination dispatch elevators are still elevators , they just use a different algorithm that you need to be aware of .
#Text=Exit promptly when your floor comes .
#Text=You do not want to be carried past your floor , as it wastes more time on a floor you do not want to go to .
#Text=Plus , there are no floor buttons , so you cannot just select your floor .
#Text=Should you miss your floor , exit at the next floor , enter your destination floor , and repeat the process again .
#Text=Responding if the Elevator Stops
#Text=Locate the floor panel .
#Text=The floor buttons on the panel are disabled , except in emergencies .
#Text=Press the floor buttons like on normal lifts .
#Text=Sometimes , the destination dispatch system fails , forcing passengers to push floor buttons like they had to before destination dispatch .
#Text=Press the and button .
#Text=Sometimes , the door jerks open while the elevator is in motion .
#Text=This breaks the safety and applies the emergency brake .
#Text=Press the button .
#Text=Newer elevators will call for help should the alarm button be held for extended periods of time .
#Text=Press the button .
#Text=Give the operator the elevator number , which floor you are at , and any other useful information .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Travelling in a group ?
#Text=Press the group button or enter your floor as many times as there are passengers .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Do not ride elevators in the case of a fire , a building evacuation , or any other emergency .
#Text=Do not overload an elevator .
#Text=An elevator that is overloaded will announce it is overloaded and refuse to move .
#Text=You can also break the elevator or its cables , causing serious injuries .
#Text=Do not attempt to obstruct the doors with limbs to hold it open .
#Text=Once the elevator alarm sounds , the doors will continue to close and ignore any sensor input that holds the door open .
#Text=Do not ride an elevator that was taken out of service .
#Text=The elevator could malfunction , causing serious injury or death .
